result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. Dyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David A. Dyer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David A. Dyer was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • David A. Dyer was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With good time and Huber release, but only after the jail sentence served in Count 3.

miscConds.notes: Payment of costs + DNA surcharge + Domestic abuse surcharge = $543 - payment to be worked out with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today and including any form of THC, without a valid prescription. 
No entry into any bars, taverns, or restaurants that serve alcohol.

AODA evaluation and follow through.
Mental Health evaluation and follow through.
Anger Management evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
Must complete some type of cognitive thinking program.
Must complete some type of 12-step program.
DNA sample due 09-22-2022.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: With good time and Huber release.
Payment of costs + DNA surcharge + Domestic Abuse surcharge = $543 due within 6 months or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.

records.addlTxt:
1:07 PM Defendant David A. Dyer in court, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for David A. Dyer.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court heard on off record discussion with counsel in chambers.
ADA agrees.
Atty Hansen agrees.
Atty Hansen provides plea form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Hansen agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 2.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 3.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Non-citizen advisory.
Court informs of firearm restriction due to the domestic abuse charges.
Deft understands.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Elements of offense.
Atty Hansen satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Counts 2 and 3.
Court dismisses outright Count 1.
ADA heard on sentencing.
Atty Hansen heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 2: 
9 months jail with good time and huber release, but only after the jail sentence served in Count 3, and places Deft on probation for 2 years.
Conditions of probation:
Payment of costs + DNA surcharge + Domestic abuse surcharge = $543.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today and including any form of THC, without a valid prescription.
No entry into any bars, taverns, or restaurants that serve alcohol.
AODA evaluation and follow through.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.
Anger Management evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling, and follow through as recommended by agent.
Must complete some type of cognitive thinking program.
Must complete some type of 12-step program.
DNA sample due 09-22-2022.
Court imposes on Count 3:
90 days jail with good time and huber release.
Credit for 69 days time served.
Payment of costs + DNA surcharge + Domestic abuse surcharge = $543.00 due within 6 months or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
DNA sample due 09-22-2022.
Appeal rights.
1:35 PM

Defendant David A. Dyer appeared by Zoom video, in custody at MCJ.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for David A. Dyer.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
3:19 p.m.
Copy of Information.
Waives reading.
Enters not guilty pleas.
Requests STC.
3:20 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 04:10 pm.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing and Order to Bind Over

Defendant David A. Dyer appeared by Zoom video, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for David A. Dyer.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin.

Prelim Questionnaire/Waiver filed.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim.
Deft bound over for trial.
Arraignment already scheduled.

Copy of complaint.
Atty Lyon heard - has reviewed with deft.

Request prelim within time limits.

Arraignment scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:15 AM Defendant David A. Dyer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court reviews charges and max penalties.
Deft understands.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $5000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid prescription, no contact with K.N., K.N.'s 13 year old son, or the residence, must surrender all firearms, may not leave the state of WI for any reason.
Deft to contact the Public Defender today.
Court schedules with parties.
9:19 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
